chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus C. ALLEN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $518.00 court costs paid from cash bail.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Sex offender treatment and follow through.

No contact with any victims.

Other than work related or family members, no contact with anyone under the age of 18.

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

timeConds.notes: under the Huber Law, to commence today.

Defendant in custody.
The State files an Amended Information which amends the charge to 3rd degree sexual assault, contrary to Section 940.225(3) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge.  Convicted.
Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report, along with a Psycho-Sexual Evaluation (or its equivalent), be completed by DOC.
PSI is due to the court by 10-10-14.
Sentencing is set for 10-24-14 at 10:00 a.m.

Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 05-15-14 at 10:00 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  Minutes.
Jewel Scharenbroch, Public Defender.
Preliminary hearing is reset to 04-21-14 at 3:30 p.m.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 04-17-14 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

At 3:58 p.m., $3,000.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 1st degree sexual assault of child.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-14-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $3,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with R.M.S. DOB: 01-11-2003; no contact with anyone under the age of 18; no contact with any school or school property; no contact with any property where there is a crossing guard, either adult or child, present; and during the times when children are coming and going to and from Madison School, the defendant must remain in his residence.  Those times are from 7:30 a.m. to 8:20 a.m. and from 3:05 p.m. to 3:30 p.m.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
